data.name: Blastoise & Piplup-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Splash Maker
attacks.text: You may attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. If you do, heal 50 damage from those Pokémon for each card you attached to them in this way.

attacks.name: Bubble Launcher-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 150 more damage. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Purugly

attacks.name: High Hat
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon's nest and claims it as its own.

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Sunny Castform, Rain Castform, or Snow-cloud Castform and switch it with Castform. (Any cards attached to Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Holon Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card. If Castform has any Holon Energy cards attached to it, draw 2 more cards.

data.name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Charging Horn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: With its horns, it digs burrows to sleep in at night. In the morning, damp soil clings to its body.

data.name: Amaura
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Sail Fossil
data.flavorText: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.

data.name: Starmie

attacks.name: Deep Sea Swirl
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 7 cards.

attacks.name: Balance Bind
attacks.text: If you and your opponent have the same number of Benched Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

data.name: Electrode

abilities.name: Magnetic Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand.

data.flavorText: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

data.name: Politoed

abilities.name: Frog Song
abilities.text: Whenever Politoed's attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), if there are more than 3 Poliwags, Poliwhirls, Poliwraths, and/or Politoeds in play (including your opponent's), that attack does 40 more damage (no matter how many heads you get). This power stops working while Politoed is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Whenever three or more of these get together, they sing in a loud voice that sounds like bellowing.

data.name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Berserker Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

abilities.name: Reactive Colors
abilities.text: If Kecleon has any React Energy cards attached to it, Kecleon is Grass, Fire, Water, Lightning, Psychic, and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Tongue Whip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Avalugg

attacks.name: Frozen Ground
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from their hand during their next turn.

data.flavorText: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.

data.name: Buizel
data.flavorText: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

data.name: Vanilluxe

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Frozen Breath
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Each of its two heads has a brain, and when they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies by exhaling a violent blizzard.

data.name: Hitmonlee
data.flavorText: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.

data.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Seafaring
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Torkoal.

abilities.name: Snappy Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Aipom is on your Bench, you may draw a card. Then, discard all cards attached to Aipom and put Aipom on the bottom of your deck. You can't use more than 1 Snappy Move Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Snap Tail
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Alolan Golem

attacks.name: Electromagnetic Bomb
attacks.text: Move any number of Lightning Energy from your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each Energy card you moved in this way.

attacks.name: Super Zap Cannon
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's grumpy and stubborn. If you upset it, it discharges electricity from the surface of its body and growls with a voice like thunder.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Tyrogue

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Tyrogue is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Tyrogue by attacks.

attacks.name: Mischievous Punch
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. Tyrogue is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Even though it is small, it can't be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Houndoom.

data.name: Unown [S]

abilities.name: Set
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown S, Unown E, and Unown T on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

data.name: Azumarill

attacks.name: Deep Dive
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.

data.name: Panpour
data.flavorText: It does not thrive in dry environments. It keeps itself damp by shooting water stored in its head tuft from its tail.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Dark Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Musharna

attacks.name: Precognitive Dream
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.

data.name: Team Aqua Grunt
rules: Discard a card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card, you can't play this card.) Draw 3 cards. If you discarded a Team Aqua Pokémon, draw 1 more card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Vanillite

attacks.name: Snow Squall
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: Theoretically, this Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. Their breath is -58° F.

attacks.name: Turnaround Standby
attacks.text: During your next turn, any damage done by Mawile's Swallow or Bite to your opponent's Active Pokémon is increased by 40 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Swallow
attacks.text: Remove from Mawile the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Squaredance
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the total number of Pokémon in play. For each heads, you may search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.

data.name: Marshtomp

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has made its legs sturdy.

attacks.name: Scary Face
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Toxicroak-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Triple Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Smash Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Super Hypno Wave
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Soak Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may take up to 2 Grass Energy cards attached to your other Pokémon and attach them to Erika's Bellsprout. This power can't be used if Erika's Bellsprout is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Stretch Vine
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Thick Skinned
abilities.text: Snorlax can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. This power can't be used if Snorlax is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Graveler

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

data.flavorText: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Fletchinder

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: Its speed right after takeoff already puts it in the top speed class of all bird Pokémon.

data.name: Scizor

attacks.name: Special Blow
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Special Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has a steel-hard body. It intimidates foes by upraising its eye-patterned pincers.

data.name: Graveler

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Graveler does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It rolls on mountain paths to move. Once it builds momentum, no Pokémon can stop it without difficulty.

data.name: Minun

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Tag Team Boost
attacks.text: If Plusle is on your Bench, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.

data.name: Simipour

attacks.name: Scald
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

data.name: Alomomola

attacks.name: Borne Ashore
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from either player's discard pile onto its owner's Bench.

data.flavorText: It uses its special mucus to close the wounds of injured Pokémon. The reason for this behavior remains unknown.

data.name: Weezing

abilities.name: Toxic Virus
abilities.text: At any time between turns, each player puts 1 more damage counter on his or her Poisoned Pokémon.

attacks.name: Offensive Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.

data.name: Smeargle

attacks.name: Paint
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a type (other than Colorless) and put a Coloring counter on the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now the type you chose. If it already had a Coloring counter, remove the old one. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.

data.name: Lampent

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Magnetic Circuit
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.flavorText: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Energy Link
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Ditto.

abilities.name: Super Dynamo
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Electrode is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Electrode is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Ninetales

attacks.name: Flame Bash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. Search your deck for a number of basic Fire Energy cards up to the number of heads and attach them to any of your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Mysterious Flames
attacks.text: If you have more Energy in play than your opponent, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

data.flavorText: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.

attacks.name: Child's Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: One-Two Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

data.name: Delibird

attacks.name: Present
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It carries food all day long. When someone is lost in the mountains, it shares that food.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as Arbok is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

abilities.name: Moonglow
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost for each Solrock you have in play is 0.

attacks.name: Foresight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

attacks.name: Target Beam
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Solrock you have in play.

data.name: Jellicent

abilities.name: Cursed Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The fate of ships and crew that wander into Jellicent's habitats: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.

data.name: Volcanion ◇
rules: ◇ (Prism Star) Rule: You can't have more than 1 ◇ card with the same name in your deck. If a ◇ card would go to the discard pile, put it in the Lost Zone instead.

abilities.name: Jet Geyser
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Water Energy card from your hand. If you do, your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sauna Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

data.name: Swampert

ancientTrait.name: α Growth
ancientTrait.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon (except with an attack, Ability, or Trainer card), you may attach 2 Energy cards.

abilities.name: Diving Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a card. Shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: After a 10-hour struggle, a fisherman was able to pull one up and confirm its existence.

data.name: Cubone

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.

data.name: Kingler

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Kingler.

data.flavorText: The large pincer has 10,000 horsepower of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.

abilities.name: Ancient Wind
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Aerodactyl is your Active Pokémon, you may ignore all Poké-Bodies until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Aerodactyl is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Mantine

abilities.name: Jumbo Fin
abilities.text: If Mantyke is anywhere under Mantine, the Retreat Cost for each of your Water Pokémon is ColorlessColorless less.

attacks.name: Giant Wave
attacks.text: Mantine can't use Giant Wave during your next turn.

data.flavorText: When the waves are calm, one may encounter a swarm of Mantine swimming as if they are in flight.

data.name: Avalugg

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Melting Floe
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. For each Water Energy card you discarded in this way, discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back make it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

data.name: Lapras-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Collect

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Ice Beam-GX
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Bidoof
data.flavorText: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

data.name: Magmortar

attacks.name: Burst Punch
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Ground Burn
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of their deck. This attack does 100 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp. It avoids this method when hunting prey.

data.name: Shining Volcanion

attacks.name: Dual Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Quad Smash
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.

data.name: Donphan

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Vikavolt

abilities.name: Strong Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Energy card and a Lightning Energy card and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Electro Cannon
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.

data.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magmar in order to use this attack.

data.flavorText: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Hoopa-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Scoundrel Ring
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon-EX (except for Hoopa-EX), reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hyperspace Fury
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Samurott

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.

data.name: Floatzel

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Aqua Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

abilities.name: Magnetic Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Metal Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Beldum is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Metal Charge
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on Beldum.

data.name: Alolan Vulpix

abilities.name: Snowed In
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

data.flavorText: If you carelessly approach it because it's cute, the boss of the pack, Ninetales, will appear and freeze you.

data.name: Lickilicky

attacks.name: Licking Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon for each Energy attached to Lickilicky. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Stick and Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Lickilicky. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It has space in its throat to store saliva. It can also roll up its tongue and store it in the same spot.

data.name: Galarian Obstagoon

abilities.name: Wicked Ruler
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may have your opponent discard cards from their hand until they have 4 cards in their hand.

attacks.name: Knuckle Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.flavorText: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.

data.name: Cubchoo
data.flavorText: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.

data.name: M Gyarados-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

data.name: Ludicolo

ancientTrait.name: α Recovery

attacks.name: Astonish

attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Splash Dance attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Team Aqua's Great Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Team Aqua Pokémon and a basic Water Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Cryogonal

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Ursaring

attacks.name: Cross Chop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, it unfailing finds all food buried deep underground.

data.name: Championship Arena
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
At the end of each player's turn, if that player has 8 or more cards in his or her hand, that player discards a number of cards until that player has 7 cards left in his or her hand.

data.name: Dark Golduck
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.
